result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jake M. Wendt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jake M. Wendt
Current: 1890 Eva Rd Apt 8, Kronenwetter, WI 54455 United States  (Effective: 05-16-2017)
Prior: P O Box 756, Gaylord, MN 55334-0756 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Jake M. Wendt
Current: P O Box 756, Gaylord, MN 55334-0756 United States  (Effective: 10-27-2016)
Prior: 1215 Eagle Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (filed in 15CM905)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:44 am 
INCLUDES 15CM514, 15CM905, AND 15CM1153. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
Atty Mort withdraws NGI plea. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM905: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1153: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM514: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM1153: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Mort makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On each count>>12 months MCJ with huber for school/work/job search/mental health treatment/doctor's appointment if def qualifies to run concurrent to each other and payment of court costs. 
COURT authorizes jail to be served on EMP if def qualifies. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 51 days credit on all. 
Adj: 11:02 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:05 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM514, 15CM905, AND 15CM1153. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Austin Mort. 
Date and time set for hearing on deft's motion for bond modification. 

BOND HEARING IN 15CM1153. 
Argument. 
COURT questions parties regarding jury trial dates in older files. 
Atty Mort states intent to change pleas in all files to not guilty by reason of mental defect. 
Argument by the State re: bond modification. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT denies motion to modify bond. 

CHANGE IN PLEA HEARING IN 15CM514, 15CM905, AND 15CM1153. 
Plea on all: Not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect (NGI). 
COURT orders examination be made. 
Atty Mort to draft order. 
COURT removes jury trial and FPT dates from the calendar. 

Calendar call set for 7/14/2015 at 1pm with Br. 2 JA. 

Adj: 3:15 pm

Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 9:03 a.m. 
**Includes 15CM514 & 15CM905**
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Austin Mort. Date & time set for Change of Plea for defendant. Attorney Mort states defendant no longer wishes to change plea and requests future dates be set. 
COURT advises parties to set future dates for both cases with JA following court. 
Adj: 9:04 a.m.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
